bug.author: mr-fcharles
bug.description:
Hi! I'm trying trying hard to redirect traffic from port 80 of my server to port 8501 where Streamlit runs by default. I tried both the methods described linked in the official faq (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/wiki/FAQ>here</denchmark-link> ) aka the one with apache2 and the one with Nginx but after successfully using the reverse proxy (<denchmark-link:https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/configuring-apache-2-4-for-proxy/1866/4>here</denchmark-link> ) the page gets stuck and never loads (as shown in the picture below) <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29484911/80186808-e0f46a80-860e-11ea-9181-0ff5a0875be8.png></denchmark-link>
I successfully managed to use the following command on ubuntu to reroute traffic from port 80 to 8051 sudo iptables -t nat -A PREROUTING -i eth0 -p tcp --dport 80 -j REDIRECT --to-port 8501 However I'm really looking forward to get it working with either apache2 or Nginx in order to use https. I'm currently using streamlit 0.58

comments.comment: Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mr-fcharles>@mr-fcharles</denchmark-link> , Did you try setting CORS to false as it is shown <denchmark-link:https://docs.streamlit.io/troubleshooting/not-loading.html?#symptom-2-the-app-says-please-wait-forever>here</denchmark-link> ?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/arraydude>@arraydude</denchmark-link> tried that now, now everything works perfectly, thanks a lot!
